title: Dreams (Smokin Beats song)
text:
"Dreams" is a song by English <a href="house%20music">house</a>/<a href="UK%20garage">UK garage</a> duo <a href="Smokin%20Beats">Smokin Beats</a>, featuring singer Lyn Eden on vocals. It was first released on the duo's own label Smokin Beats in 1996, then released as an official <a href="Single%20%28music%29">single</a> on the <a href="AM%20PM%20Records">AM:PM</a> label in 1997, containing <a href="remix">remix</a>es by <a href="Erick%20Morillo">Erick Morillo</a>, <a href="Ian%20Pooley">Ian Pooley</a> and <a href="Kings%20of%20Tomorrow">Kings of Tomorrow</a>. The song peaked at No. 23 on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a>, and also reached No. 1 on the <a href="UK%20Dance%20Singles%20Chart">UK Dance Singles Chart</a> in January 1998.
In 2015, a set of remixes was released on Hot Source Records containing mixes by artists such as <a href="Tough%20Love%20%28duo%29">Tough Love</a>, <a href="DJ%20Q">DJ Q</a>, <a href="Oxide%20%26amp%3B%20Neutrino">Oxide & Neutrino</a>, Low Steppa, and drum & bass producers Upgrade and Klax. "<a href="Vice%20%28magazine%29">Vice</a>" and Breakbeat.co.uk gave positive reviews of the remixes by DJ Q and Klax, respectively.
<a href="Redbull.com">Redbull.com</a> included "Dreams" in their list of "10 underground UK garage classics that still sound fresh today".
